title: Sell Signatory Vintage Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Signatory Vintage CS Collection | Rare Independent Bottlings | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Signatory Vintage Cask Strength whisky. We buy the 'dumpyle' bottles (Prestonfield) and Cask Strength Collection bottles.
heroSubhead: Buying Signatory Cask Strength and Rare Reserve bottlings.
introParagraph: Signatory Vintage is one of Scotland's premier independent bottlers. Their 'Cask Strength Collection' (decanter style) and older 80s/90s 'dumpy' bottles harbor incredible liquid.
whatWeBuy: Signatory Closed Distilleries (Port Ellen, Brora, Dallas Dhu)
photoChecklist: Front label showing Distillery and Vintage
conditionFactors: Tin Condition: The metal tins dent easily. Perfect tins command a premium.
Label: Signatory labels provide exact dates; legibility is key.
Color: Dark sherry bombs (Clynelish, Edradour) are highly sought after.
Fill: Older dumpy bottles often have cork issues; check level.
pricingFactors: Distillery: A Signatory Laphroaig is worth more than a Signatory Strathmill.
Series: The 'Prestonfield' series (burlap sack/dumpy bottle) is legendary.

faqs.question: Do you buy the 86 proof bottles?
faqs.answer: We buy them, but they are generally drinking stock, not high-value collector stock, unless it is a closed distillery.

faqs.question: What is 'Prestonfield'?
faqs.answer: An early series bottled for the Prestonfield House Hotel. Famous for incredible Bowmore and Clynelish.

faqs.question: Do you buy Edradour?
faqs.answer: Yes, Signatory owns Edradour. We buy the older single casks.

faqs.question: How much for a closed distillery bottle?
faqs.answer: Port Ellen or Brora in Signatory livery can fetch $2,000+ depending on vintage.

faqs.question: Do you buy G&M too?
faqs.answer: Yes, we buy Gordon & MacPhail and Cadenhead's.

faqs.question: What if the tin is rusty?
faqs.answer: It happens. We will deduct slightly for presentation, but the liquid is what matters.
